body_html: @mbz what if you run it with less threads? (intra_op_parallelism_threads=1, inter_op_parallelism_threads=1). Sometimes it's useful to get a stack trace under gdb using where or thread apply all backtrace. Running it with "-c dbg" compiled version of TensorFlow will give line numbers
body_text: @mbz what if you run it with less threads? (intra_op_parallelism_threads=1, inter_op_parallelism_threads=1). Sometimes it's useful to get a stack trace under gdb using where or thread apply all backtrace. Running it with "-c dbg" compiled version of TensorFlow will give line numbers
body: @mbz what if you run it with less threads? (intra_op_parallelism_threads=1, inter_op_parallelism_threads=1). Sometimes it's useful to get a stack trace under `gdb` using `where` or `thread apply all backtrace`. Running it with "-c dbg" compiled version of TensorFlow will give line numbers
